did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Notebooks containing lists and notes on U.S. gold, silver, and base coins and proof sets, 1794-1898.

daodesc.p: A page from one of the notebooks

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: J. Colvin Randall (d. 1901) was a Philadelphia numismatist and coin dealer who was an expert in die varieties of American coins.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: J. Colvin Randall notebooks, circa 1898, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains three notebooks with handwritten labels: (1) “Types & Varieties of U.S. Gold & Silver” lists coins from 1794 to 1884; (2) “Proof Sets” has notes on U.S. silver, gold, and minor or base sets from 1857 to 1898; and (3) “Proof Sets &c” lists the number of gold, silver, and base sets from the Philadelphia Mint from 1874 to 1898.
